pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [618d5d9a27](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15314/commits/618d5d9a27d0b484ffeafa5919b6efbe6dc5e88e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ fromStalk`
`+ fromStalk_to_skyscraper`
`+ germ_fromStalk`
`+ germ_res'`
`+ germ_res_apply'`
`+ germ_skyscraperPresheafStalkOfSpecializes_hom`
`+ mem_basicOpen''`
`+ stalkFunctor_map_germ_apply`
`+ stalkFunctor_map_germ_apply'`
`+ stalkMap_germ'_assoc`
`+ toOpen_Î“germ_apply`
`+ to_skyscraper_fromStalk`
`++ mem_basicOpen'`
`++-- stalkToFiberRingHom_germ'`
`+-+- stalkMap_germ`
`+--- stalkMap_germ'`
`- germ_stalkIso_hom'`
`- mem_basicOpen_top'`
`-++- stalkMap_germ_apply`
`-+-+ mem_basicOpen`
`-+-+ stalkToFiberRingHom_germ`
`-- stalkMap_germ'_apply`
`--++ germ_comp_stalkToFiberRingHom`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
!bench
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/16ac14d6-0e85-4137-9024-31edb805f951) for commit 1fdb51f9c2c281c5d8ae775251477ba2ceda5850.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7511b840-2692-4966-ab1a-64ca294e2af0) for commit 4d414008294f4061c86bb5b4ef0893d39cc38bb5.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/fdc5bb28-232d-446d-a847-bf6a2f88ea03/to/7511b840-2692-4966-ab1a-64ca294e2af0) against commit 17008649d994c4238fa1b6a709c37290e5acc2b8:
```diff
  Benchmark                                     Metric         Change
  ===================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Topology.Sheaves.LocallySurjective   instructions   -57.3%
```
Not the drastic change I hoped for. At least I got rid of a dozen `erw`s.
I just wrote a review, but it doesn't seem to have gone through? Will investigate...
Oh it did go through!
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11269796390/job/31339133245)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11269796390/job/31339133851)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
maintainer merge
This is clearly an improvement given the number of porting notes, adaptation notes and `erw` removed. Also, the arguments were always provided with `mk`, never bundled.
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I guess that's somewhat unrelated, but why is this not
```suggestion
    obtain âŸ¨x, âŸ¨hxU, hxâ‚âŸ©, _, hxâ‚‚âŸ© :=
```

```suggestion
  replace e : ((Spec.topMap (algebraMap R S) _* (structureSheaf S).val).germ _ p hpr) s' = y := by
```
and please check you're not having extra brackets in other similar places
Like here and below

```suggestion
    apply (h z ((iVU x).le hzVx)).mul_right_inj.mp
```
It took me forever to find, so I will signpost it: This is the main change in this PR

Sorry, I don't have a huge amount of intuition about general presheaves, but isn't there always a morphism `F U -> stalk F x`, regardless of whether x is in U or not? My mental picture is the presheaf of continuous functions, and there the stalk at a point contains eg constant functions. This would mean that you can use a junk value when x is not in U and therefore get rid of `hx` in the definition
I don't think you can guarantee `F.obj (op U) âŸ¶ stalk F x` is nonempty (so that you can choose a junk map) for general categories. And even in `Type`, `stalk F x` might not be non-empty.
Making this an `abbrev` has little to do with the rest of the PR, right? Might be worth splitting out to gain more fine-grained information about the performance impact of your changes

```suggestion
  have := (X.presheaf.germ _ _ hs).isUnit_map (RingedSpace.isUnit_res_basicOpen _ s)
```

```suggestion
  rw [â† map_pow, â† map_zero (X.presheaf.germ _ x hxU)] at e
```

```suggestion
    erw [map_mul, map_one, show X.presheaf.germ _ x hxW ((X.presheaf.map (U.infLELeft V).op) f) =
      X.presheaf.germ U x hx f from X.presheaf.germ_res_apply (Opens.infLELeft U V) x hxW f,
      show X.presheaf.germ _ x hxW (X.presheaf.map (U.infLERight V).op g) =
      X.presheaf.germ _ x hxV g from X.presheaf.germ_res_apply (Opens.infLERight U V) x hxW g]
```

```suggestion
    change X.presheaf.germ _ z hzVx _ * (X.presheaf.germ _ z hzVx _) =
      X.presheaf.germ _ z hzVx _ * X.presheaf.germ _ z hzVy (g y)
```

```suggestion
    convert RingHom.isUnit_map (X.presheaf.germ _ y hy) hf
```

```suggestion
  Â· exact (subsheafToTypes P).presheaf.germ _ x U.2 âŸ¨f, hâŸ©
```

```suggestion
      tU = (subsheafToTypes P).presheaf.germ _ x (unop W).2 âŸ¨s, hWâŸ© âˆ§
        tV = (subsheafToTypes P).presheaf.germ _ x (unop W).2 âŸ¨s, hWâŸ© :=
```

```suggestion
    use â„±.germ _ x hxV s
```

```suggestion
    set t_x := ð’¢.germ _ x hxU t with ht_x
```

```suggestion
  convert congr_arg (F.germ _ x hxW) heq using 1
```

```suggestion
    âˆƒ (U : Opens X) (m : x âˆˆ U) (s : F.obj (op U)), F.germ _ x m s = t := by
```

```suggestion
      F.germ _ x hxU sU = F.germ _ x hxV sV := by
```

```suggestion
lemma germ_residue (x hx) : X.presheaf.germ U x hx â‰« X.residue x = X.evaluation U x hx := rfl
```
if you want

```suggestion
/-- A variant of `mem_basicOpen` without the `x âˆˆ U` assumption. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Topology/Sheaves): Unbundle `germ`.
